abstract.text: Creates a regex component that matches a URL substring, capturing it as a Foundation URL.

inlineContent.text: for matching the URL scheme component.
All the parameters to this method take a
value to configure the matching behavior for one component of the URL. The three possible values are:
— The URL component needs to be present for matching to succeed.
— The URL component doesn’t need to be present for matching to succeed.
— If the URL component is absent, the captured URL contains the provided default value for the component.
that matches a URL, when it contains a scheme and a host. It then matches against a source string that contains a date formatted in the
locale, some whitespace, and a valid URL. The regex defines a default value for the port with
, and because the source URL doesn’t include a port, the captured URL adds it.

code: guard let match = source.firstMatch(of: matcher) else { return }

abstract.text: Build apps using a powerful open language.
A type that represents a regular expression.
Creates a regex component that matches a URL substring, capturing it as a Foundation URL.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
The strategy used to parse one component of a URL.
A strategy that provides a default value for a component if it’s absent in the source string.
A strategy that treats the presence of the associated component as optional.
A strategy that requires the presence of the associated component for parsing to succeed.
A value that identifies the location of a resource, such as an item on a remote server or the path to a local file.
A parse strategy for creating URLs from formatted strings.
The strategy used to parse one component of a URL.
